subject: Re: [junit] Automatically testing implementations via interface
msgSnippet: ... Google Abstract Test Case . It s always easy when you know the name of the thing. :) -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
informationlaboratory wrote:

> I am happy to use naming conventions for test classes and packages.
> So I always place tests into sub-package called 'test'
> and always name tests for class Foo FooTest. Here is what I am
> trying to do:
>
> Create an AbstractImplementationTest class that extends TestSuite
> - defines method called getTestObject()
> - introspects the Class of the test object and extracts all
> of the interfaces that it implements
> - Creates and instantiates corresponding test classes
> - adds them as test cases
>
> Does this make sense? Has anyone already done this already?

Google "Abstract Test Case". It's always easy when you know the name of
the thing. :)
